title: Mass of LiOH needed to absorb CO2 from astronaut

In a one-person spacecraft, an astronaut exhales <math alttext="880 grams " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>880</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="44 grams per mole " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>44</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>g</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mtext>mol</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>) per day. To prevent the buildup of <math alttext="C O 2, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the spacecraft, a device containing <math alttext="L i O H, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LiOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is used to remove the <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented by the equation above.
content.question: What mass of <math alttext="L i O H, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LiOH</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="24 grams per mole " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) is needed to react with all of the <math alttext="C O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by an astronaut in one day?
